website_summaries.verdict: The sugar alcohol xylitol is a great choice for those who follow the keto diet, since it has a very low glycemic impact.
pros: Pure sugar alcohol, not blended with other substitutes
Minimal glycemic impact, ideal for sweets and desserts
Contains 1/3 the calories of other sugar substitutes
cons: Does not dissolve easily in beverages

customer_reviews.title: A good sugar replacement
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace sugar in my diet and this was recommended. I was skeptical because other sweeteners just left an aftertaste in my mouth and a craving for sugar. I was pleasantly surprised by this option. While it isn't as fine as sugar, it is equal to sugar. You can measure it exactly like sugar, no need for conversion charts and it does not have a bad taste or aftertaste. It tastes like sugar in everything I've used it in/on. I'm glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Del Kroemer

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Do your research or , at least try it before getting large amounts. This stuff gave me WICKED acid reflux. I felt like puking half the day after putting some in my coffee in the morning
customer_reviews.author: SACRICIDE

customer_reviews.title: At Last A Good Sugar Substitute
customer_reviews.text: On the Keto diet so sugar is out. I tried the usual substitutes but they have that horrible aftertaste (doesn't bother my wife thought). Finally I thought I would give this a try and, yay, I can enjoy my morning coffee again! Not exactly sugar but close enough. Very very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Reynard Foxe

customer_reviews.title: Tastes and bakes like sugar
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic sugar alternative. It tastes like sugar, but is much less sweet. I baked a cake with Xylitol; and it baked just like a cake made with sugar. It tasted amazing, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased this product several times without issue. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product several times without issue. This time it was all clumped and balled up as if it had been wet or something. I cannot even pour it out of the package into my dispenser without balled up chunks clogging things up. Very disappointing !!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Source of xylitol.
customer_reviews.text: Was very disappointed. It was listed with other Birch sourced xylitol and turns out the source is corn. Now what do I do with it?
customer_reviews.author: Tracy D Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great, comes out like lava
customer_reviews.text: I made some brownies with this which turned out amazing. They're really good! However, I can eat even a bite without spending the next 20 minutes sweating then the next 20 on the toilet violently evacuating my bowels. I thought my anus might fall out. Some people can tolerate this stuff, I cannot. Just know that this "natural" sweetener is chemically made and not exactly safe for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like sugar with half the calories and none of that negative effects! Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products you can't live without. If you're done with table sugar and it's nasty effects you have options. This stuff is exactly like sugar with no negative effects. It is my go to sweetener for everything I used to use sugar for. I like it even better than Stevia, which never tasted all that good anyway, to be honest. This is delicious and looks, feels, acts and behaves exactly like sugar. I can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It’s quite good, but careful because a little goes a long way! I use demerara sugar most of the times, you need less than this for the same sweetness. It doesn’t have a weird aftertaste like erytritol but it has this kinda refreshing aftertaste... a little weird for me but not a big issue. It does mess up my digestive system (I don’t use too much at all, basically just for recipes), so I have to really watch it.
customer_reviews.author: Luanda F Marinho

customer_reviews.title: My first bag of Xylitol
customer_reviews.text: After I have tried every sugar substitute I could find, I am now settled on and happy with Xylitol. I needed a sweetener that was as close to tasting like sugar, obviously, but one that also has a low glycemic index and has no aftertaste. This is it. I am not using it to bake, though you can because of its similarity to sugar, I really only want it for adding to my coffee or tea. It tastes good and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine S.

customer_reviews.title: Oh....Corn Based, Not Birch?  Made in China?!  Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had started a good review, then read the other people's reviews. Now I know where my recent diarrhea has come from. It turns out this is corn based, not birch based. Also, what isn't mentioned on the package is that it is made in China. The packaging is misleading, and I thought it was made in the USA. Also, after others mentioned, I noticed that it really doesn't dissolve in my coffee, but stays in a pile at the bottom and it isn't as sweet. I'll stick to the Xyla brand, which is made from birch, made in Finland, is sweeter and does not have as much of a laxative effect as this brand. :(
customer_reviews.author: Janice Gochnauer

customer_reviews.title: Made from Corn! Avoid! And Non Returnable!
customer_reviews.text: Non returnable! And you don’t know till you get it that it’s made from Corn! The very thing one is trying to avoid! I never even opened it and it’s non returnable! Xylitol can be made from a variety of things, but people using xylitol as a sweetener are trying to avoid corn and corn byproducts! Not be duped into buying a corn product! For shame!
customer_reviews.author: Thetruthfairandsquare

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Xylitol has great beneficial properties and I use this in my waterpik morning and night.
customer_reviews.author: kj

customer_reviews.title: Not like before. Tastes like Erythritol
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gotten this before. I don’t understand why this time it’s nothing like before. Seems more like Erythritol than xylitol to me. Takes 5 times he amount to taste like it used to. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: mediagirl

customer_reviews.title: Good xylitol, but has a few clumps
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully, this is pure xylitol, unlike the brand "Ideal Xylitol" that I unhappily discovered was actually a Xylitol blend with maltodextrin and sucralose. It tastes pretty much identical to sugar to me, and can be substituted 1 for 1 in everything from a cup of tea to a batch of oatmeal cookies. There's no aftertaste, and no unpleasant "cold-mouth" effect either. But beware! If you consume a significant amount---lets say maybe 8+ teaspoons, you might have some stomach distress (rapid bloating etc.) If anything its a good incentive to monitor your intake mindfully.
customer_reviews.author: Replicant

customer_reviews.title: Great to make tooth paste-please remember that this is toxic to cats and dogs.
customer_reviews.text: we use it to make our own toothpaste along with baking soda, coconut oil and bentonite clay, it will get rid off all plaque and leave the teeth super clean and better than using the toothpaste from the store. in this was we know exactly what goes into the tooth paste! Oh! I also add mint oil in order to the the fresh taste! Cheers to health!
customer_reviews.author: MediaBoxEnt

customer_reviews.title: The best sugar substitute on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and this brand. We have been using this for years and couldn't be happier with a sugar substitute. The benefits that this product delivers is so much healthier better for are physical health than any sugar substitute out there. There is no aftertaste that is the one of the most important things for me in a sugar substitute. As long as they make this friend I will always purchase this the price what it's great also.
customer_reviews.author: Blp

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. Basically can't survive without it as I enjoy a low glycemic diet and mix this with stevia. Stevia alone has a bad aftertaste but when mixed with this, I can make the most amazing baked products and still enjoy sweet desserts that aren't going to make me fat or raise my blood sugar. I did have to let my digestive system get used to this, but since I'm past that part, it's a staple in my diet. I even use this in buttercream icings and it dissolves to the point there's no crunch. I don't grind it or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Good small quantity sugar replacement
customer_reviews.text: Decent sugar replacement for your morning tea or coffee. You can definitely tell it's not sugar, but it is the only replacement I've found to be tolerable. I use the same amount of xylitol as I do sugar. Be warned, too much can cause diarrhea. For me that's 2-3 cups of xylitol sweetend tea, so not much.
customer_reviews.author: Padme

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative
customer_reviews.text: Totally better than anything Stevia, no or very little aftertaste, fresh sweet taste, works well as a substitute, though in my very amateur experience does not bake as well as sugar. However, after using it in my coffee and tea every day for a couple weeks, it upset my stomach and caused some digestive inconvenience, which quickly resolved once discontinued. Also note the cautions, that this product causes severe illness in pets.
customer_reviews.author: Lemming

customer_reviews.title: Small amounts causes upset stomach
customer_reviews.text: I thought I had struck gold with this sweetener. It made my coffee perfect. But only using 2 tablespoons gave me diarrhea. Two days in a row. I was hoping I was wrong so I tried using it again the next day and same thing. Sorry if this is a TMI. But I'd want to know something like this before. buying. Hope it helps. It also states that on the package.
customer_reviews.author: latoya rose

customer_reviews.title: Good taste, eh aftertaste, good value size for price
customer_reviews.text: This has a much much MUCH better flavor than many of the other alternative sweeteners I've tried, most notably stevia. There is still a slight aftertaste I'm not a huge fan of, but that may also change with time just like I never used to enjoy the taste of diet pop. I will say the bag is pretty sturdy but the sealing aspect gives way after a while of opening and closing since I don't use a lot at once. Obviously, nothing I use this in is dog friendly so no more scraps for my little Harley girl...probably a good thing in my house. Haha
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Ketoers Beware.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was looking for and of course not returnable. This is 8 grams of carbs per serving. 1 serving is 2 TEASPOONS. So 2 and a half servings would alone blow a ketoers daily allowance of carbohydrates. Can’t use it for cooking or baking as it is granular and doesn’t dissolve. Had to trash this one and go back to good old faithful -Stevia. This was not for me.
customer_reviews.author: value hunter

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE FOR DOGS!
customer_reviews.text: Most importantly...NOT SAFE FOR DOGS! It can and has killed dogs! I wouldn't give it to any pet! It IS safe for humans because we process it differently, dogs can't. PLEASE make sure you keep any baked goods or foods made with it away from pets! I have to watch my sugar, so I use it. I'm allergic to artificial sweeteners. This is not artificial. It's completely natural, made from corn. I have been using this for years and I like it. It tastes exactly like sugar to me. It has one third the calories of regular sugar and a low glycemic index. Now Foods makes great organic products.
customer_reviews.author: BanDeclawing

customer_reviews.title: Montezuma's Revenge has nothing on this product
customer_reviews.text: The initial thought after seeing it and tasting was this is amazing stuff. I had 2 teaspoons and my usual routine is 2 teaspoons of stevia. I thought I would try something new. Pfft, stick with the tried and true. 2 hours after taking I had the worst Diarrhea. Good think was it only lasted 3 hours. I read later that this could be a side effect. It's clearly not for me. Maybe youll have better luck. It has a great flavour but not worth the 3 hours of misery. Happy sweetening :)
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sugar replacement for those who do not need a zero-calorie sweetener.
customer_reviews.text: When it comes artificial sweeteners, I've tried almost all of them. Every single one of them has ended up being given away because it just don't taste good. This has not been the case with xylitol. Xylitol tastes just look sugar. It can be used exactly like sugar. It is as sweet as sugar. And while it is not zero-calorie, it is still lower in calories than table sugar (10 vs 16 per teaspoon for sugar) and has a lower glycemic index than sugar (12 vs 65 for sugar). If you are looking to cut calories or have a medical need for a lower glycemic index sweetener, xylitol may be just what you need.
customer_reviews.author: DVB

customer_reviews.title: My body did not like this. Felt sick for  a while.
customer_reviews.text: Looks are harmless but after putting some in my coffee (and it took a LOT) to even get a sweet taste. Not for everyone. Felt nauseated after drinking the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Debra W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for clearing out sinuses
customer_reviews.text: Great for clearing out sinuses, and it can serve as a sweetener, too. I can't use it as a sweetener, though, because it gives me indigestion.
customer_reviews.author: Pascal

customer_reviews.title: By far, best sugar alternative
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know how to explain this but I can absolutely tell when something has Stevia on it. Xylitol is, for me, the best alternative to sugar. It has the closest taste and texture. I don’t feel it altera the recipe’s taste dramatically. Of course it’s not the least calories out of all alternatives. But, for me, ended up being the healthiest and most flavorful one.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Kassick

customer_reviews.title: Carbs Are  Crazy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make a Keto marshmallow. This works great but carbs in this are crazy and as I can only have 20 a day making my marshmello takes a lot of my carbs. Also this is very dangerous for pets so you gotta be careful if you have pets in the house. The taste is great. You can't even tell its not sugar and it gives the marshmallows a great form. .
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is magical!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a very strict diet for my health and cannot have any sweeteners except xylitol. When I ordered I thought it would taste like the fake sugar crap in Splenda or the herbal tasting stevia but I was so wrong! It tastes so much like sugar I don't even miss the real stuff! It can be used in baking just like sugar and has a similar crystal like consistency.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaa4444

customer_reviews.title: Great Taste
customer_reviews.text: Best "sweetener" I've tasted. It has no weird after taste and tastes similar to sugar, but much lower on the glycemic index. I'm very pleased. Bought small bag to try, now for the hunt of larger quantities for decent price.. definitely not cheap, but never put that before your health, bad health is much more expensive than $9 sugar.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Makes delicious homemade ice cream
customer_reviews.text: I've been learning to make custard-based ice creams and this is by far the best sugar sub I've found for that purpose. My husband is diabetic and misses good chocolate ice cream. Swapping out half the sugar for this product resulted in a perfect balance between flavor and carbs. You honestly couldn't even tell there was anything but sugar in it. I'll be keeping it in my pantry and trying more applications and ratios.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Best sugar substitute ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. You can't even compare it to splenda or truvia or any of that kinda stuff because the taste is completely different. I tried this once at my sister's and thought it was real sugar. It's a little pricey but worth it. This is all I use in my coffee now (that's pretty much the only thing I use sugar for anyway).. And I'm just about to run out. I'll be buying another bag in a day or two for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Shavin

customer_reviews.title: Big granules but very good product
customer_reviews.text: We have been changing our diet and oral healthcare lately so this product was a must. It tastes great and I've used it in many different recipes and it has worked fine. It is not as sweet as sugar and our palettes have had to adjust a bit. Because it is so much better for our teeth, we plan to stick with using it. I was planning on also making our own jam/jelly with this but the granules are too big to dissolve properly with the method I want to use. We did a combination of sugar and/or stevia and xylitol in the beginning but transitioned to using mostly xylitol.
customer_reviews.author: happy mommy

customer_reviews.title: Be warned: It took a month before I felt the "effects"
customer_reviews.text: It took a month before I felt the "effects." The effects being: make my stomach bloat and start "talking" all day, and then... like a scene out of dumb and dumber. It took a month to have this effect on my stomach, but as soon as it took effect, each time I consumed any thereafter, I had the same experience. I had to stop using.
customer_reviews.author: Bex

customer_reviews.title: Keto Friendly and Tastes Great
customer_reviews.text: Doing the keto lifestyle and needed a good sugar replacement for baking. Made my wife a chocolate cake for her birthday and used this - it was delicious! Can't really tell the difference between this and real sugar. I've tried stevia and monkfruit but they have terrible aftertastes. I can't use aspartame because it gives me a headache and makes my fibromyalgia flare up. Xylitol by far is the best, and this was a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TCRegan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reception, easy to use, no need for pricey cable
customer_reviews.text: We connected this to our mom's TV in her nursing home apartment and pulled in 53 channels with excellent HD clarity. Much easier and cheaper than paying for cable. She has a much easier time using 1 simple TV remote control than the confusion of an xfinity remote with 2 power buttons, separate volume and power/ channel controls, etc. Comes with nice long coax cable and all connections to fit any TV you may have. We're getting another to replace the attic antenna for our own TV. Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Sugar Substitute
customer_reviews.text: Another good shipment. For a great Price. Gave up sugar but still needed a sweetner. Have tried most natural sweetners stevia, honey, maple syrup.cocconut sugar, monk fruit Each one has there own distinct flavor and added to the taste of the product. Personally I did not like stevia at all. Xylitol is Perfect for me. Tastes like sugar.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysLearning

customer_reviews.title: This is really bad!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is horrible, I felt dizzy with a sip of coffee sweetened with this thing. This spike up my sugar level. Please be careful everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Mar Campo

customer_reviews.title: Great alt. to sugar
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to sugar, the only problem is that it takes a while for it to dissolve in water. The water needs to at least be boiling for it to dissolve into it. This becomes a problems in things such as sauces or cold items and thus cannot be used because the sugar will all fall to the bottom of the cold item via gravity.
customer_reviews.author: TeaMan

customer_reviews.title: Throw your sugar out!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are working on lowering your A1C, on the keto/paler diet, or just trying to decrease sugar use this is your product. It looks like sugar and has no after taste. Xylitol has multiple benefits like dehydrating bacteria in your mouth that cause cavities (this is the sweetener in Trident gum). It is an easy transition.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Shade

customer_reviews.title: Sugar like, but minor laxative effects
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very "sugar like" in use and taste. Closest to sugar I have uses. Seems to be a little harder to dissolve in cold liquids. I use in coffee and lemonade. Cons: Take too much and it has laxative effects. Found this out on a hot day after drinking about 4 big glasses of lemonade while working in yard. For some this may even be a benefit, for me I need to just limit it to maybe two tablespoons per day.
customer_reviews.author: Marc E. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Xylitol
customer_reviews.text: I really use a lot of Now Food supplements. Although it is not birchwood, which I cannot afford, it is Non GMO. It is so great to have a safe sugar substitute; I never liked stevia. Again, a great price. Just like sugar, without the harmful effects. Delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Dakininan

customer_reviews.title: Omg!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I am in awe that this is not real sugar. It sure tastes like one... If you like your coffee sweet like myself get this stuff! I can't even tell it's not sugar. Amazing. Delicious. Definitely recommend and will never use real sugar again.
customer_reviews.author: Bruna G

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best but Decent
customer_reviews.text: Bag came leaking some of it out and it definitely looked old, as if it had not only been thrown around but had been around for quite a while before I got my hands on it. Kind of disappointing and I was expecting more, but I guess for the price it was a good value. It just looked dirty on the outside and I don't really want to use it for anything because of that. I don't really trust it to put it in my mouth or in food because of the condition it came in. Aside from that, seems to be great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lin Wu

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product with an INCORRECT description
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product with an INCORRECT description. Description says "Xylitol powder" - which is what I was looking for. The product is actually granulated crystals. For my purposes, the distinction between powder and granulated crystals is important. UPDATE: I see my review submitted for the '1 pound powder' is also used for the '2.5 pound bag' of granulated crystals. The description for the crystals is accurate. Both products are excellent but I am still searching for xylitol powder.
customer_reviews.author: DANE C STERNECKER

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Sweetener!
customer_reviews.text: To me, xylitol has the best taste for a sugar substitute. We use it to flavor our coffee and cereal and substitute it for cooking preparations. It doesn't have a bitter taste and we can use half of it compared to what would be required for sugar. Of course it's much healthier and that makes it taste even better.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: No returns
customer_reviews.text: My package arrived with a much larger package of coconut flour. The flour was fine, but the sugar had a big rip in the center left side. No returns. Sugar all over the box and counter.....next time, buy at store which I just found out carries it in a neighboring town.
customer_reviews.author: Steph Strafaci

customer_reviews.title: Taste good.
customer_reviews.text: At first I ate something prior to trying it and thought it tasted weird . However now I really like it, theres really no after taste. Id say it tastes like sugar but not as sweet so you have to kind of use more of it. I actually really like this as a sugar substitute. Its reasonably priced as well. I put it in my coffee . I find that it hasn’t gave me headaches or any symptoms so far either.
customer_reviews.author: Darion

customer_reviews.title: Gave me terrible acid reflux
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer, I had terrible acid reflux from using this in my coffee. For half the day I felt like I was going to vomit and had terrible cramping. So I would agree, i'ts definitely not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: NYC

customer_reviews.title: Gritty - does not disolve
customer_reviews.text: I've used Splenda for years (I'm diabetic) and thought I'd try xylitol. My husband mixed xylitol with some unflavored Greek yogurt and brought it to me. The xylitol does not dissolve so it was gritty and unpleasant to eat. It works ok in hot coffee but only in something hot. So depending on how you plan to use it, keep this in mind before you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Judy B. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great sweetener for keto
customer_reviews.text: Great sweetener for keto! Especially if you want to lose weight by extreme diarrhea! Be careful if you use more than 1 tablespoon in your coffee. You won't be able to trust a fart all day
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Amaryllis

customer_reviews.title: good in small amounts
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my husband to put in his morning coffee, he said if he uses too much he gets intestinal problems. Aka running to the bathroom. So definitely be careful, don't use an excessive amount.
customer_reviews.author: Mm22

customer_reviews.title: Great for diabetes
customer_reviews.text: I have diabetes (type 2) and started using this in my tea. Works wonders - my A1c dropped from a 6.9 to a 5.2. I don't cook with it.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Speaks

customer_reviews.title: Not what you think
customer_reviews.text: This is not a 1 to 1 trade off. It is not anywhere near as sugar and if you do try to use it as a 1 to 1 trade off be aware it can give you a severe case of the trots.
customer_reviews.author: HarksGirl

customer_reviews.title: very impressed
customer_reviews.text: first experience with xylitol and am very impressed. I would challenge someone to eat some of this straight with a spoon and tell the difference between this and real sugar. I will be ordering this again.
customer_reviews.author: PMI

customer_reviews.title: Made out of corn.
customer_reviews.text: This Now brand of Xylitol is made from corn! I am used to Xylitol that is made out from Birch tree and so I found an organic xylitol which I like better.Organic xylitol power by microingredients superfoods. It comes in a 6 lb. bag and just cost just pennies more than the Now Brand.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G.

customer_reviews.title: Xylitol is the best
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Much better than the sugar alternatives and since it helps to fight cavities instead of causing them can’t beat it. Same usage amount as normal sugar. Can’t tell any difference and no side effects noted. Love this stuff
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sugar substitute. Though some have digestive disturbances like gas, I don't have any problems. I only use it to sweeten my tea or coffee but I feel good not using sugar. Not harmful like sweet&low, (a neuro-toxin) which is a great ant killer as they bring it back to their nest and no more ants. I tried it and it really works. Just have to mix a bunch of it in some kind of medium to make it moist, like pudding or jello so they will take the bait! LOL Splenda or Equal have been proven to cause tumors, so stevia, lakanto, and Xylitol are the only non sugar sweeteners I use.
customer_reviews.author: Jillybean16

customer_reviews.title: Sweet and healthy.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe something so sweet and delicious has 30% less calories then sugar, does not cause teeth to rot and actually remineralizes teeth end bones. I use it every day in tea and coffee and I cook with it. It should be noted, however, that this product is toxic to dogs. A typical high quality NOW product.
customer_reviews.author: George L

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great, but there are cons.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this sugar substitute but never got used to it from a digestive standpoint. It caused several bouts of diarrhea with each & every serving. Will not repurchase for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: NO After taste!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product for baking - looks, feels and measures much like real sugar AND it has no after-taste! We're Weight Watchers - this fits very well into our food program. It's also good for diabetics. I'm making a (WW) cheesecake with this for dinner guests next week - one of them is diabetic. A GREAT product!
customer_reviews.author: Betty A. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Sugar replacement
customer_reviews.text: I recently started using this in the Thai peanut sauce I make at home. It's a great 1:1 replacement when you need to have the added bulk and texture that sugar provides in a recipe. I usually like to use stevia, but stevia doesn't quite cut it for peanut sauce when I want it to be a certain thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Mara Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Better than erythritol!
customer_reviews.text: Tastes way better than erythritol. I like this brand. All their stuff seems really good to us. Measures and bakes like sugar. No conversion, you can use less if you want, stuff turns out great.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: For pulling and cheese cake too!
customer_reviews.text: ⭐I used this to make mouth pulling, it helps remove the buildup without the need of toxic chemicals Here is the recipe: 4 drops teat tree oil 2 tbs of coconut oil 1 tsp of xylitol ⭐you do it every day for 10 minutes and you will have the cleanest teeth ever! Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: MediaBoxEnt

customer_reviews.title: Tastes just like sugar
customer_reviews.text: Thing I love about xylitol is it tastes just like sugar to me. I am unable to digest to much of it though or it bothers my stomach. I use every morning in my coffee with no problems, but if I try to bake with it when you need more than 1/4 cup it bothers my stomach. Overall very satisfied and will purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: A buyer

customer_reviews.title: Tastes just like sugar
customer_reviews.text: In baking it tastes exactly like sugar. If no heat is used, it may take a while to dissolve, but I am impressed how much it tastes like sugar, is not offensive like stevia.
customer_reviews.author: Simone

customer_reviews.title: fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: great alternative to sugar! great taste however it doesnt dissolve like sugar does but other than that its great. and the ziplock part on the bag sometimes doesnt close completely.
customer_reviews.author: melissa chavez

customer_reviews.title: Teeth healthy sugar sub
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the flavor of this xylitol. I mostly buy it to blend with erythritol and stevia. I think combining the 3 tastes most like sugar. I do use the xylitol exclusively in some recipes that call for it with great results.
customer_reviews.author: SoonerMom1

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AVOID AVOID
customer_reviews.text: I bough this to put in my coffee. It’s not real xylitol, and made the milk in my coffee taste sour and bad. I also tried baking with it-was slightly better tasting but it gave me terrible diarrhea the next day. Seriously, I just wouldn’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: bridget fowler

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Xylitol, used instead of toothpaste, reverses gum disease. After several painful and expensive periodontal surgeries, which did NOT correct the problem, I read an article about xylitol written by Karl Denninger. With nothing to lose, I gave it a try. My gums began to improve after the first few months, since xylitol actually KILLS the bacteria in your mouth that causes plaque to build up. Now, after 2+ years, I do not have gum disease. I will always use xylitol instead of toothpaste.
customer_reviews.author: JKL

customer_reviews.title: Great for KETO
customer_reviews.text: I've been learning how to bake keto bread and desserts. Most recipes call for Xyletol or Swerve instead of chemical sugar substitutes. This stuff is great in coffee, too.
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate - it's great
customer_reviews.text: Great product. NOW Foods is a good company I've been purchasing products from they for many years. I was initially concerned about the difference between Xylitol from birch and the NOW brand which is from corn. An email to NOW was quickly answered and they put my concerns to rest. If you've not had xylitol before, it looks and tastes like regular white sugar, except the crystals are a bit larger, and there is a slight cool feeling in your mouth, but no aftertaste at all. It measures the same as sugar and cooks/bakes just the same. Great for strawberries too!
customer_reviews.author: Katz

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: SUPER expensive product but if it's good for your teeth it's cheaper than cavities and root canals. It tastes good too. I don't use it to bake with I use it for homemade mouthwash
customer_reviews.author: Nms

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this sugar replacement for my mother and she loves the taste compared to other sweetness. Will definitely buy for her again!
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Rivadeneira

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great taste and outrageously expensive compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great taste and outrageously expensive compared to granulated sugar. A 25-pound bag of granulated sugar costs $18 at Costco and this product is almost $15 for 2.5 pounds. What's the best value? If you're looking for a granulated sugar substitute, that's natural and has fewer calories and price is no object, then Xylitol is you. If you're on a budget, stick with granular sugar, just less of it.
customer_reviews.author: dbflowers

customer_reviews.title: Good amount for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good amount for the price. I use this to sweeten homemade toothpaste. It's a little gritty so I put the whole bag in a blender jar until it's a fine powder.
customer_reviews.author: bargain hunter

customer_reviews.title: This tastes great in my coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have read that it is a better alternative to artificial sweeteners and sugars. I use it daily in my coffee and have maintained a 40# weight loss.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Danklefsen

customer_reviews.title: I was happy with this brand , but my last order is like fluffy powder
customer_reviews.text: I always buy the NOW products and have been buying their Xylitol ... very disappointed to have my last order's consistency being powdery ... not at all like crystals of sugar ... something seems wrong with it so am going back to my original Emerald Forest xylitol
customer_reviews.author: sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor/pure ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to this and still waiting to see how my body responds. Flavor is good and product is pure. I would recommend doing some research before trying.
customer_reviews.author: WeHave4

customer_reviews.title: false advertising
customer_reviews.text: Well it certainly is not POWDER as advertised, so that was annoying. I had to grind it in my coffee grinder to get it pulverized which of course never does the greatest job in getting things to a powder. So its great for xylitol granules. But that's not what I wanted, nor what is specified here.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen's Vegan Bakery

customer_reviews.title: Sugar-Free
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making sugar-free mints. Just melted some xylitol then added some drops of peppermint extract. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Dibla

customer_reviews.title: Just like sugar!
customer_reviews.text: Tastes just like suger without all the calories. Just be careful before you over induldge...if you have a sensitive stomach, do not use much of this as it can make you sick. Use small portions at fist until you get used to it, otherwise you may end up with serious gas and bloating. I started off slowly as I do have a sensitivity to this product, but have now switched completely to use in my tea and homemade chocolates without an issue. The taste is much more pleasing than stevias, which can be very bitter, this stuff you can practically eat out of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Gave me canker sores, 2 thumbs down, won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHOICE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sugar to make my keto ice cream. Very happy with the result. The third time i make the ice cream i leave it in the freezer for 4 days and it didn't get hard. I made the right choice with this sugar. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Bag doesn’t close
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough for xylitol in general, but the crystals are HUGE and very hard to dissolve in anything other than Hot liquid. Just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: M Fo

customer_reviews.title: It comes in granules like sugar. I have also used it in cheesecake ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time trying Xylitol. It has really helped us cut down on the amount of sugar that we put into our coffee. I am down to one tsp of this product and NO sugar! It comes in granules like sugar. I have also used it in cheesecake and it is so sweet. I love this and am re-ordering!
customer_reviews.author: Speechville

customer_reviews.title: Great for diabetics. You do not have to sacrifice flavor with this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: The number one thing for me is taste. Being a diabetic I have to be very careful, and this stuff taste great and it does not elevate my blood sugar. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MTChristi

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great product, great service!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! The Price is great as are the health benefits! My dentist was shocked at how improved my teeth were at my last visit. This product has also been a big help with my digestive system.
customer_reviews.author: Happy1

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. Quick shipping turnaround. I use this to replace the sugar in my cakes and banana breads. You can not tell the difference. Perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Helton

customer_reviews.title: This is the first time I've used xylitol for a sweetener and I'm in love! Used it to sweeten ice cream
customer_reviews.text: Have used Truvia for years. This is the first time I've used xylitol for a sweetener and I'm in love! Used it to sweeten ice cream. Now, as a diabetic, I can have ice cream that doesn't spike my blood sugar. Will keep buying.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I Mix Xylitol & Erythritol together for Keto Recipes. It works better than either by itself and keeps me away from Deadly Sugar.
customer_reviews.author: sohocook

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price, fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, have used for a few years. I find no difference from traditional 'white sugar', except that Xylitol has a low glycemic and doesn't harm enamel. Arrived on time, no problems with seller. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: SuiteDee

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Why wouldn't anyone use this instead of sugar or man-made material? It tastes great but doesn't satisfy the sugar addiction. Cleanse yourself of a sugar addiction and it will be even better.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great !!!
customer_reviews.text: I totally switched from sugar to xylitol. Use it for tea and coffee. No aftertaste at all. Great packaging and fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: Taste good in my homemade toothpaste
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to my homemade toothpaste, I have to be very careful with it for if my little dogs ingest it, they will be dead in less than half an hour, so I won't be buying it anymore
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Always Happy With This Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and good pricing. I mix this with the same amount of erythritol and use it as a sugar substitute in equal measure as sugar. No aftertaste and great for me as a diabetic.
customer_reviews.author: Kings

customer_reviews.title: Special use
customer_reviews.text: Can't use as sugar--for me--causes abdominal pain. BUT I make my own xylitol-peppermint oil mouth rinse. Gave up xylitol gums/hard candy. Helps with coffee breath and dry mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Paul P.

customer_reviews.title: Keto friendly
customer_reviews.text: Great in cold keto recipes. However if you are keto baking, be prepared to add an additional 2-3 hours of COOLing time. I am sure there is a scientific reason for this, but I don’t know it. It is almost like the xylitol needs to get completely cold again to solidify. BUT honestly, who cares if it means i can bake keto cookies, brownies, and pumpkin bread?!??
customer_reviews.author: Buffy

product_meta.title: NOW Foods, Xylitol, Pure with No Added Ingredients, Keto-Friendly, Low Glycemic Impact, Low Calorie, 2.5-Pound
product_meta.description:
Size:40 Ounce (Pack of 1)| Style:XylitolNOW Real Food® Xylitol is the incredible sweetener that more and more people are turning to as an ideal substitute for sugar. Unlike sugars such as sucrose and fructose, this naturally occurring sugar alcohol won’t promote tooth decay, has a low glycemic impact, and has around one-third the calories of other sugars, making it a cleaner sweetener that’s hard to beat. NOW Real Food® Xylitol is derived from non-GMO corn and is the perfect substitute for sugar in almost any application.

BRAND STORY
By NOW Foods
feature_bullets: XYLITOL: An incredible sweetener that more and more people are turning to as an ideal substitute for sugar.

NO OTHER ADDED INGREDIENTS: Unlike sugars such as sucrose and fructose, this naturally occurring sugar alcohol won’t promote tooth decay, has a low glycemic impact, and has around one-third the calories of other sugars, making it a cleaner sweetener that’s hard to beat.
1/3 FEWER CALORIES THAN SUGAR: Our xylitol is derived from non-GMO corn and is the perfect substitute for sugar in almost any application.
Packaged in the USA by a family owned and operated company since 1968.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
